2: “Dominion[b] and awesome might[c] belong to[d] God; he establishes peace in his heights.[e]
3: Can his armies be numbered?[f] On whom does his light[g] not rise?
4: How then can a human being be righteous before God? How can one born of a woman be pure?[h]
5: If even the moon is not bright, and the stars are not pure as far as he is concerned,[i]
6: how much less a mortal man, who is but a maggot[j]— a son of man, who is only a worm!”
